edu.iastate.cs228.game
Interface SystemState

public interface SystemState

A static copy of the state of a system.

Method Summary
 Color[] getAgentsPresent()
          Colors for agents present in the system.
 int getCostToCapture()
          Retrieve the cost to capture this system.
 int getEnergyStored()
          Retrieve amount of energy stored in this system.
 int getGeneratorCount()
          Retrieve number of generators in this system.
 int getMaximumGeneratorCount()
          Retrieve maximum number of generators that can appear in this system.
 String getName()
          Retrieve the name of the system.
 SystemState[] getNeighbors()
          Retrieve the states of all neighbors reachable via wormhole from this system.
 Color getOwner()
          Retrieve color of this system.
 int[] getTravelCost()
          Array of costs to get from this system to the corresponding system returned by getNeighbors().
 

Method Detail

getName

String getName()
Retrieve the name of the system. This will be unique in this galaxy.

Returns:
the name of this system

getOwner

Color getOwner()
Retrieve color of this system.

Returns:
the color of the agent that owns the system

getGeneratorCount

int getGeneratorCount()
Retrieve number of generators in this system.

Returns:
number of generator units in this system

getMaximumGeneratorCount

int getMaximumGeneratorCount()
Retrieve maximum number of generators that can appear in this system.

Returns:
maximum number of generator units for a system

getEnergyStored

int getEnergyStored()
Retrieve amount of energy stored in this system.

Returns:
amount of energy stored at this system

getCostToCapture

int getCostToCapture()
Retrieve the cost to capture this system.

Returns:
number of turns/energy units is costs to capture this system

getNeighbors

SystemState[] getNeighbors()
Retrieve the states of all neighbors reachable via wormhole from this system. Systems out of scanning range but a neighbor of one that is within range will appear as a null entry.

Returns:
array of systems representing the neighbors of this system

getTravelCost

int[] getTravelCost()
Array of costs to get from this system to the corresponding system returned by getNeighbors(). If the neighbor is not scanned, cost to that system will be 0 (as you did not scan this cost).

Returns:
array of costs to travel to neighbors

getAgentsPresent

Color[] getAgentsPresent()
Colors for agents present in the system. Empty array if no agents.

Returns:
array of Colors representing agents present in this system
